stories.headline: Robot feats
stories.bodyText:
The fastest 100-meter dash was 33.71 seconds — impressive for a hunk of wires, but still over 3x SLOWER than Usain Bolt’s human record.

The robots ran so awkwardly that some looked like your uncle jogging back to the car because he left the lights on

stories.headline: Statue for the Bird
stories.bodyText:
Bird said her first career WNBA points and her final points 20 years later were both layups, making the pose deeply meaningful.

The statue also depicts her wearing Nike Air Zoom Huarache sneakers, the same model she wore during the Storm’s first championship and her first Olympic gold medal in 2004.

stories.headline: NINE times
stories.bodyText:
The Yankees hit nine home runs vs. the Rays, matching their nine-homer explosion back in March against the Brewers, making them the first team in MLB history with two nine-homer games in one season.

Only four teams in MLB history have ever hit nine or more homers in a game — the record is 10 by the 1987 Blue Jays.

stories.headline: Bookmark this Page
stories.bodyText:
Bueckers’ 44 points tied for the 10th-most in WNBA history, cementing her performance among the league’s most memorable scoring outbursts.

The WNBA single-game record is 53 points, set by Liz Cambage in 2018.

stories.headline: Rox rock Shohei
stories.bodyText:
Even before the Rockies loss, Ohtani had been limited — he has not thrown more than 4⅓ innings or 80 pitches in any start this season.

Ohtani missed the entire 2024 season recovering from elbow surgery, making 2025 his comeback year on the mound.

stories.headline: Celeb sighting!
stories.bodyText:
Roughly a month after Bueckers said her dream courtside celebrity guests are Grey's Anatomy's Ellen Pompeo and Criminal Minds' Shemar Moore, Moore decided to pull up for the Wings' game vs. the Sparks in L.A.—and he picked a great night to do it.

After the game, Moore met Bueckers in the tunnel, capping off her “best night ever.

questions.question: At China’s first “Robot Olympics,” what blazing 100-meter dash time did Unitree’s humanoid sprinter clock in at?
questions.backstory: The fastest 100-meter dash was 33.71 seconds — impressive for a hunk of wires, but still over 3x SLOWER than Usain Bolt’s human record.
questions.funFact: The robots ran so awkwardly that some looked like your uncle jogging back to the car because he left the lights on

questions.question: Sue Bird is the first WNBA player honored with a statue outside her team’s arena. What symbolic detail did she choose for her statue’s pose?
questions.backstory: Bird said her first career WNBA points and her final points 20 years later were both layups, making the pose deeply meaningful.
questions.funFact: The statue also depicts her wearing Nike Air Zoom Huarache sneakers, the same model she wore during the Storm’s first championship and her first Olympic gold medal in 2004.

questions.question: In their 13–3 win this week over the Rays, the Yankees became the first MLB team ever to do what in a single season?

options.text: Go back-to-back-to-back twice in one game

questions.backstory: The Yankees hit nine home runs vs. the Rays, matching their nine-homer explosion back in March against the Brewers, making them the first team in MLB history with two nine-homer games in one season.
questions.funFact: Only four teams in MLB history have ever hit nine or more homers in a game — the record is 10 by the 1987 Blue Jays.

questions.question: Paige Bueckers’ 44-point game this week against the Sparks tied for what spot on the WNBA’s all-time single-game scoring list?
questions.backstory: Bueckers’ 44 points tied for the 10th-most in WNBA history, cementing her performance among the league’s most memorable scoring outbursts.
questions.funFact: The WNBA single-game record is 53 points, set by Liz Cambage in 2018.

questions.question: The Rockies tagged Shohei Ohtani this week for 5 runs on 9 hits in his first career start at Coors Field. In 10 pitching starts this season, what is the longest Shohei Ohtani has gone in terms of innings or pitch count?
questions.backstory: Even before the Rockies loss, Ohtani had been limited — he has not thrown more than 4⅓ innings or 80 pitches in any start this season.
questions.funFact: Ohtani missed the entire 2024 season recovering from elbow surgery, making 2025 his comeback year on the mound.

questions.question: Which celebrity — one of Paige Bueckers’ “dream courtside guests” — attended her 44-point breakout game against the Sparks in Los Angeles?
questions.backstory: Roughly a month after Bueckers said her dream courtside celebrity guests are Grey's Anatomy's Ellen Pompeo and Criminal Minds' Shemar Moore, Moore decided to pull up for the Wings' game vs. the Sparks in L.A.—and he picked a great night to do it.
questions.funFact: After the game, Moore met Bueckers in the tunnel, capping off her “best night ever.
